title.en-US: GIS and Remote Sensing in Vegetation Ecology

description.en-US: Using advanced GIS and remote sensing techniques to study vegetation patterns and ecological processes.

content.value: Our research focuses on applying cutting-edge GIS and remote sensing technologies to understand vegetation dynamics and ecological processes.

description.en-US: Studying the interactions between ecological processes and spatial patterns at various scales.

content.value: We investigate how spatial patterns influence ecological processes and how these processes create and modify landscape patterns.

description.en-US: Long-term monitoring of forest ecosystems using remote sensing and field observations.

content.value: This project combines satellite imagery with ground-based measurements to monitor forest health and dynamics.

description.en-US: Mapping and analyzing urban vegetation patterns using high-resolution satellite imagery.

content.value: Using advanced remote sensing techniques to map and monitor urban vegetation for better city planning and environmental management.
Specializing in GIS and remote sensing applications in ecological research.
